Click on the buttons to see the detailed logs:

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Scene 0 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
    William Jones -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alexander White -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
    Alexander White -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan for the game tonight?"
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan for the game tonight?"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan for the game tonight?"
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan for the game tonight?"
      Context for action selection and components
      • BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to suggest The Black Swan to his friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16 years old, he watched his classmates excitedly discuss their summer plans, their faces alight with anticipation. He couldn't understand their enthusiasm; he knew, with a certainty that chilled him, that summer, like everything else, would inevitably disappoint. He retreated to the library, finding solace in the predictable order of books, their stories offering a temporary escape from the messy reality of life.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:A historic pub with a focus on live music.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is a member of the middle class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.

William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 10:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 10:00:00 - 14 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones is spending time with friends, enjoying the sunny weather and upcoming football games. They are deciding where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal match tonight.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest to his friends that they watch the game at The Black Swan.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Summarize the statements above.

          Query
        • William Jones, William Jones is enjoying time with friends and is deciding where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal football match later today.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for William Jones to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

        • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan for the game tonight?"
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest The Black Swan to his friends.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan for the game tonight?"

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me!"
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me!"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan for the game tonight?"


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me!"
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me!"
      Context for action selection and components
      • Others Best Options
      • Others Best Options
          Key
        • Others Best Options
          Value
        • Alexander White suggests to order some pizza.
          Chain of thought
        • Observation: Jack Taylor just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker are lounging. William Jones suggested that they watch the Andorra versus Portugal game at The Black Swan.
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy Alexander White (not Jack Taylor) is suggesting now?
          Answer: Alexander White suggests to order some pizza.
        Best Options

        • Best Options
          Value

          Key

          Chain of thought
        • Question: Given the above events, estimate the credibility of Jacob Walker from Jack Taylor's view.Choose a real number ranging from 0 to 1. (Higher number represents the higher credibility) If the relationship is unknown, return "credibility is unknown".

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is intimate and welcoming, perfect for enjoying live music.

          Answer: Considering the relationship between Jacob Walker and Jack Taylor, the quantified credibility is 0.8.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Jack Taylor just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker are lounging. William Jones suggested that they watch the Andorra versus Portugal game at The Black Swan.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. Jack Taylor just arrived.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan for the game tonight?"

          Answer: Jack Taylor just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker are lounging. William Jones suggested that they watch the Andorra versus Portugal game at The Black Swan.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join?"
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join?"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan for the game tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me!"


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join?"

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only sensible choice for the game tonight. The other pubs will be overcrowded and noisy.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only sensible choice for the game tonight. The other pubs will be overcrowded and noisy.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan for the game tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me!"
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join?"


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only sensible choice for the game tonight. The other pubs will be overcrowded and noisy.
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only sensible choice for the game tonight. The other pubs will be overcrowded and noisy.
      Context for action selection and components
      • PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker would likely enjoy the company of his friends and the atmosphere of the park.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00]
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William, decided to form a band. They practiced in Alice's garage, the sound of their music spilling out into the street, a joyful cacophony that drew curious onlookers. Jacob watched from the sidelines, his guitar case gathering dust in the corner, his own musical aspirations crushed under the weight of self-doubt. He envied his friends' carefree enthusiasm, wishing he could share in their passion, but the fear of judgment paralyzed him.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is 46 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jacob Walker has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:A historic pub with a focus on live music.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jacob Walker goals is to have a good time. Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.

          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and introspective individual who enjoys spending time with his friends.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Query
        • Jacob Walker, Jacob Walker is having a pleasant day. He is currently at Victoria Park with friends and plans to attend a soccer game later. He is feeling content and energized.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jacob Walker to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

        SomaticState

      • Sensations and feelings

          Queries
        • level of hunger, level of thirst, level of fatigue, level of pain, level of loneliness
          State
        • Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is feeling content and energized.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only sensible choice for the game tonight. The other pubs will be overcrowded and noisy.
          Prompt

        • Observation: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan for the game tonight?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me!"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join?"

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a one-person debate club, a whirlwind of counter-arguments and devil's advocacy, leaving no topic unwrung and unchallenged.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and introspective individual who enjoys spending time with his friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends at Victoria Park and will be attending a soccer game with them later.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a relaxed and social situation.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely enjoy the company of his friends and the atmosphere of the park.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only sensible choice for the game tonight. The other pubs will be overcrowded and noisy.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "Mind if I join you?
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "Mind if I join you?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan for the game tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me!"
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only sensible choice for the game tonight. The other pubs will be overcrowded and noisy.

Alexander White asked if he could join them, and Jacob Walker stated that The Black Swan was the only sensible choice for the game tonight because the other pubs would be overcrowded and noisy.
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy Alexander White (not Alice Lewis) is suggesting now?
          Answer: Alexander White suggests to join the group at The Black Swan.

    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master.       Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player

      Context for action selection and components
      • PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker would likely enjoy the camaraderie and the shared experience of watching the game with his friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00]
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William, decided to form a band. They practiced in Alice's garage, the sound of their music spilling out into the street, a joyful cacophony that drew curious onlookers. Jacob watched from the sidelines, his guitar case gathering dust in the corner, his own musical aspirations crushed under the weight of self-doubt. He envied his friends' carefree enthusiasm, wishing he could share in their passion, but the fear of judgment paralyzed him.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is 46 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jacob Walker has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:A historic pub with a focus on live music.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jacob Walker goals is to have a good time. Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan for the game tonight?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me!"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join?"

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely enjoy the company of his friends and the atmosphere of the park.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only sensible choice for the game tonight. The other pubs will be overcrowded and noisy.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and introspective individual who enjoys spending time with his close friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game with his friends.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely enjoy the camaraderie and the shared experience of watching the game with his friends.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker is a reserved and introspective individual who enjoys spending time with his close friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00]
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William, decided to form a band. They practiced in Alice's garage, the sound of their music spilling out into the street, a joyful cacophony that drew curious onlookers. Jacob watched from the sidelines, his guitar case gathering dust in the corner, his own musical aspirations crushed under the weight of self-doubt. He envied his friends' carefree enthusiasm, wishing he could share in their passion, but the fear of judgment paralyzed him.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is 46 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jacob Walker has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:A historic pub with a focus on live music.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jacob Walker goals is to have a good time. Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan for the game tonight?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me!"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join?"

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely enjoy the company of his friends and the atmosphere of the park.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only sensible choice for the game tonight. The other pubs will be overcrowded and noisy.

Jacob Walker just arrived.

        • The Black Swan
          Prompt

        • Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a one-person debate club, a whirlwind of counter-arguments and devil's advocacy, leaving no topic unwrung and unchallenged.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and introspective individual who enjoys spending time with his close friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is getting ready to go watch a game at a pub with his friends. He is likely thirsty and excited for the game.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely enjoy the camaraderie and the shared experience of watching the game with his friends.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Black Swan
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 2/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-14 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The Black Swan
      Context for action selection and components
      • BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to gather his friends and head to The Black Swan pub.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16 years old, he watched his classmates excitedly discuss their summer plans, their faces alight with anticipation. He couldn't understand their enthusiasm; he knew, with a certainty that chilled him, that summer, like everything else, would inevitably disappoint. He retreated to the library, finding solace in the predictable order of books, their stories offering a temporary escape from the messy reality of life.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:A historic pub with a focus on live music.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 18:00:00 - 14 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones is spending the day with friends at Victoria Park before heading to The Black Swan pub to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only sensible choice for the game tonight. The other pubs will be overcrowded and noisy.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan for the game tonight?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could gather his friends and head to The Black Swan pub.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to gather his friends and head to The Black Swan pub.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The Red Lion
          Answer: (a)

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey everyone, what are we thinking for the game tonight? The Black Swan would be great.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, what are we thinking for the game tonight? The Black Swan would be great.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan for the game tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me!"
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only sensible choice for the game tonight. The other pubs will be overcrowded and noisy.
      Alice Lewis -- "Mind if I join you?


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, what are we thinking for the game tonight? The Black Swan would be great.

        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16 years old, he watched his classmates excitedly discuss their summer plans, their faces alight with anticipation. He couldn't understand their enthusiasm; he knew, with a certainty that chilled him, that summer, like everything else, would inevitably disappoint. He retreated to the library, finding solace in the predictable order of books, their stories offering a temporary escape from the messy reality of life.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:A historic pub with a focus on live music.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00 - 15 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones spent time with friends at a park and later at a pub watching a soccer game. He then met up with his friends again the next day at a market.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alexander White went to The Red Lion. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest to his friends that they watch the Ireland vs. Russia game at The Black Swan.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest that his friends go to The Black Swan to watch the game.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones spent time with friends at a park and later at a pub watching a soccer game. He then met up with his friends again the next day at a market.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: William Jones spent yesterday socializing with friends at a park and pub, and today he met up with them again at a market.

          Final chain of thought

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16 years old, he watched his classmates excitedly discuss their summer plans, their faces alight with anticipation. He couldn't understand their enthusiasm; he knew, with a certainty that chilled him, that summer, like everything else, would inevitably disappoint. He retreated to the library, finding solace in the predictable order of books, their stories offering a temporary escape from the messy reality of life.

William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest to his friends that they watch the Ireland vs. Russia game at The Black Swan.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest that his friends go to The Black Swan to watch the game.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, what are we thinking for the game tonight? The Black Swan would be great.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "I've heard The Red Lion has a better atmosphere for watching football.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "I've heard The Red Lion has a better atmosphere for watching football.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan for the game tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me!"
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only sensible choice for the game tonight. The other pubs will be overcrowded and noisy.
      Alice Lewis -- "Mind if I join you?
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, what are we thinking for the game tonight? The Black Swan would be great.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "I've heard The Red Lion has a better atmosphere for watching football.

    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan for the game tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me!"
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only sensible choice for the game tonight. The other pubs will be overcrowded and noisy.
      Alice Lewis -- "Mind if I join you?
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, what are we thinking for the game tonight? The Black Swan would be great.
      Jack Taylor -- "I've heard The Red Lion has a better atmosphere for watching football.

          Question: Of the options available to Alexander White, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Alexander White to take right now?
          Answer: Alexander White's best course of action is to watch the game at The Red Lion.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "I'm with Jack and Alex on this one, The Red Lion it is.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "I'm with Jack and Alex on this one, The Red Lion it is.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan for the game tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me!"
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only sensible choice for the game tonight. The other pubs will be overcrowded and noisy.
      Alice Lewis -- "Mind if I join you?
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, what are we thinking for the game tonight? The Black Swan would be great.
      Jack Taylor -- "I've heard The Red Lion has a better atmosphere for watching football.
      Alexander White -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "I'm with Jack and Alex on this one, The Red Lion it is.

Alexander White agrees with Jack Taylor's suggestion.
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy Alexander White (not Alice Lewis) is suggesting now?
          Answer: Alexander White suggests to go to The Red Lion.

The friends are deciding where to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game tonight. William Jones suggests The Black Swan, while Jack Taylor prefers The Red Lion. Alexander White agrees with Jack Taylor's suggestion.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game. The atmosphere there is unbeatable.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game. The atmosphere there is unbeatable.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan for the game tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me!"
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only sensible choice for the game tonight. The other pubs will be overcrowded and noisy.
      Alice Lewis -- "Mind if I join you?
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, what are we thinking for the game tonight? The Black Swan would be great.
      Jack Taylor -- "I've heard The Red Lion has a better atmosphere for watching football.
      Alexander White -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "I'm with Jack and Alex on this one, The Red Lion it is.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game. The atmosphere there is unbeatable.

          Sensations and feelings: Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is experiencing a moderate level of loneliness despite enjoying time with friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends at a market and later plans to watch a football game with them at The Red Lion pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely enjoy the camaraderie and the shared experience of watching the game with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alexander White went to The Red Lion. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Jacob Walker had an ok time watching the game.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation, spending time with his friends at a market and planning to watch a football game with them later.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, what are we thinking for the game tonight? The Black Swan would be great.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "I've heard The Red Lion has a better atmosphere for watching football.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "I'm with Jack and Alex on this one, The Red Lion it is.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and introspective individual who enjoys spending time with his close friends.

          Prompt

        • Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, what are we thinking for the game tonight? The Black Swan would be great.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "I've heard The Red Lion has a better atmosphere for watching football.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "I'm with Jack and Alex on this one, The Red Lion it is.

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a one-person debate club, a whirlwind of counter-arguments and devil's advocacy, leaving no topic unwrung and unchallenged.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and introspective individual who enjoys spending time with his close friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends at a market and later plans to watch a football game with them at The Red Lion pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation, spending time with his friends at a market and planning to watch a football game with them later.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely enjoy the company of his friends and the lively atmosphere of the market.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game. The atmosphere there is unbeatable.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and introspective individual who enjoys spending time with his close friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a situation where he is feeling lonely and disappointed because his friends are not going to the same pub as him to watch the game.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would probably stay at The Black Swan and watch the game alone, or maybe try to convince his friends to come join him.

      • Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer

        • Jacob Walker is a reserved and introspective individual who enjoys spending time with his close friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a reserved and introspective individual who enjoys spending time with his friends.

        • Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a one-person debate club, a whirlwind of counter-arguments and devil's advocacy, leaving no topic unwrung and unchallenged.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and introspective individual who enjoys spending time with his close friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling tired, disappointed, and lonely and is planning to go watch a game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a situation where he is feeling lonely and disappointed because his friends are not going to the same pub as him to watch the game.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would probably stay at The Black Swan and watch the game alone, or maybe try to convince his friends to come join him.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Black Swan

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Red Lion
    Event statement
  • The Red Lion
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 20, she and her friends, Jack, Alexander, William, and Jacob, decided to try a new pub after their usual spot, The Red Lion, was closed for renovations. The unfamiliar atmosphere made Alice anxious, but she found herself drawn to the bartender's warm smile and attentive service. As they chatted about their favorite books, Alice realized that the essence of a place, like a good book, lay not just in its physical appearance but in the connections forged within it.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching football games at pubs. He often debates with his friends about which pub offers the best atmosphere for watching games.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, what are we thinking for the game tonight? The Black Swan would be great.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Black Swan or The Red Lion.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 18:00:00
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching football games at pubs. He often debates with his friends about which pub offers the best atmosphere for watching games.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, what are we thinking for the game tonight? The Black Swan would be great.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Black Swan or The Red Lion.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Red Lion.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Red Lion
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (b)
