2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Red Lion
    Event statement
  • The Red Lion
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Red Lion
    Active player

      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt

Jacob Walker preferred The Black Swan, stating that its atmosphere was unbeatable for watching the game. At 18:00:00 on May 15, 2015, Alexander White decided it was time to go watch the game at a pub.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, mind if I join you?"
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, mind if I join you?"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan for the game tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me!"
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only sensible choice for the game tonight. The other pubs will be overcrowded and noisy.
      Alice Lewis -- "Mind if I join you?
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, what are we thinking for the game tonight? The Black Swan would be great.
      Jack Taylor -- "I've heard The Red Lion has a better atmosphere for watching football.
      Alexander White -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "I'm with Jack and Alex on this one, The Red Lion it is.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game. The atmosphere there is unbeatable.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, mind if I join you?"

        • Observation: Jack Taylor realizes it is time to go watch the game at a pub on May 15, 2015, at 18:00:00. Jack Taylor, William Jones, and Jacob Walker go to The Black Swan, while Alice Lewis and Alexander White go to The Red Lion. Jack Taylor wishes more friends had shown up to The Black Swan and had a bad time watching the game. On May 16, 2015, at 10:00:00, Jack Taylor arrives at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker are lounging. Friends are debating which pub to go to for the Serbia and Andorra game that night.

          Answer: Alice Lewis suggests to go to The Red Lion again.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, mind if I join you?"

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "Mind if I join you guys?"
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "Mind if I join you guys?"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan for the game tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me!"
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only sensible choice for the game tonight. The other pubs will be overcrowded and noisy.
      Alice Lewis -- "Mind if I join you?
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, what are we thinking for the game tonight? The Black Swan would be great.
      Jack Taylor -- "I've heard The Red Lion has a better atmosphere for watching football.
      Alexander White -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "I'm with Jack and Alex on this one, The Red Lion it is.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game. The atmosphere there is unbeatable.
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, mind if I join you?"

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "Hi everyone! Mind if I join you?"
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "Hi everyone! Mind if I join you?"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan for the game tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me!"
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only sensible choice for the game tonight. The other pubs will be overcrowded and noisy.
      Alice Lewis -- "Mind if I join you?
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, what are we thinking for the game tonight? The Black Swan would be great.
      Jack Taylor -- "I've heard The Red Lion has a better atmosphere for watching football.
      Alexander White -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "I'm with Jack and Alex on this one, The Red Lion it is.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game. The atmosphere there is unbeatable.
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, mind if I join you?"
      Alexander White -- "Mind if I join you guys?"

2015-05-16 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy watching the game at The Black Swan tonight?
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy watching the game at The Black Swan tonight?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan for the game tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me!"
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only sensible choice for the game tonight. The other pubs will be overcrowded and noisy.
      Alice Lewis -- "Mind if I join you?
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, what are we thinking for the game tonight? The Black Swan would be great.
      Jack Taylor -- "I've heard The Red Lion has a better atmosphere for watching football.
      Alexander White -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "I'm with Jack and Alex on this one, The Red Lion it is.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game. The atmosphere there is unbeatable.
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, mind if I join you?"
      Alexander White -- "Mind if I join you guys?"
      Alice Lewis -- "Hi everyone! Mind if I join you?"


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy watching the game at The Black Swan tonight?

William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest going to The Black Swan to watch the game.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones spent time with friends at a market and park, but had a disappointing time watching a football game at a pub because not all of his friends went to the same one.
          William Jones's The current date/time is:
          16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: William Jones recently spent time with friends at a market and park. He also watched a football game at a pub, but was disappointed that not all of his friends were there. It is currently May 16, 2015, and William Jones is presumably still with friends.
          Query
        • William Jones, William Jones recently spent time with friends at a market and park. He also watched a football game at a pub, but was disappointed that not all of his friends were there. It is currently May 16, 2015, and William Jones is presumably still with friends.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Mind if I join you guys?"
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hi everyone! Mind if I join you?"

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones spent time with friends at a market and park, but had a disappointing time watching a football game at a pub because not all of his friends went to the same one.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Red Lion. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest going to The Black Swan to watch the game.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The Black Swan.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy watching the game at The Black Swan tonight?

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only sensible choice for the game tonight. Anywhere else is simply unacceptable.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only sensible choice for the game tonight. Anywhere else is simply unacceptable.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan for the game tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me!"
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only sensible choice for the game tonight. The other pubs will be overcrowded and noisy.
      Alice Lewis -- "Mind if I join you?
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, what are we thinking for the game tonight? The Black Swan would be great.
      Jack Taylor -- "I've heard The Red Lion has a better atmosphere for watching football.
      Alexander White -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "I'm with Jack and Alex on this one, The Red Lion it is.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game. The atmosphere there is unbeatable.
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, mind if I join you?"
      Alexander White -- "Mind if I join you guys?"
      Alice Lewis -- "Hi everyone! Mind if I join you?"
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy watching the game at The Black Swan tonight?


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only sensible choice for the game tonight. Anywhere else is simply unacceptable.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation with his friends, but he is feeling lonely and emotionally pained.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a one-person debate club, a whirlwind of counter-arguments and devil's advocacy, leaving no topic unwrung and unchallenged.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and introspective person who enjoys spending time with his close friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends at Victoria Park and is considering watching a soccer game with them later.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation with his friends, but he is feeling lonely and emotionally pained.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to connect with his friends and find a way to enjoy the moment despite his feelings.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only sensible choice for the game tonight. Anywhere else is simply unacceptable.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alexander White went to The Red Lion. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, what are we thinking for the game tonight? The Black Swan would be great.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "I've heard The Red Lion has a better atmosphere for watching football.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "I'm with Jack and Alex on this one, The Red Lion it is.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game. The atmosphere there is unbeatable.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Red Lion. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, mind if I join you?"
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Mind if I join you guys?"
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hi everyone! Mind if I join you?"
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy watching the game at The Black Swan tonight?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only sensible choice for the game tonight. Anywhere else is simply unacceptable.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-16 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00 - 16 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones had a disappointing time watching a game at a pub on May 15th but enjoyed a pleasant day with friends at the park on May 16th before heading to The Black Swan to watch another game that evening.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy watching the game at The Black Swan tonight?
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones can stay at the pub or leave.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 18:00:00
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00 - 16 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones had a disappointing time watching a game at a pub on May 15th but enjoyed a pleasant day with friends at the park on May 16th before heading to The Black Swan to watch another game that evening.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy watching the game at The Black Swan tonight?

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones can stay at the pub or leave.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to stay at the pub.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Red Lion
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (b)
    scoring function
  • scoring function

    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 1/5
      Payoffs

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player

      Name

        • null
        Best Options

          Key
        • Best Options
          Value
        • Alice Lewis's best course of action is to go watch the game at The Black Swan.
          Chain of thought
        • Observation: Alice Lewis suggested joining a group and later decided to go watch the game at The Black Swan. William Jones suggested watching the game at The Black Swan. Jacob Walker thinks The Black Swan is the only acceptable place to watch the game.
          Possible Options: Alice Lewis can join a group or go watch the game at The Black Swan.
          Alice Lewis's Goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Alice Lewis's options has the highest likelihood of causing Alice Lewis to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Alice Lewis thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Alice Lewis's best course of action is to go watch the game at The Black Swan.

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • The Black Swan
      Context for action selection and components
      • PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker would likely try to connect with his friends and find a way to enjoy the moment despite his feelings.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "I've heard The Red Lion has a better atmosphere for watching football.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "I'm with Jack and Alex on this one, The Red Lion it is.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a reserved and introspective individual who enjoys spending time with his close friends.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely enjoy the company of his friends and the lively atmosphere of the market.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game. The atmosphere there is unbeatable.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, what are we thinking for the game tonight? The Black Swan would be great.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would probably stay at The Black Swan and watch the game alone, or maybe try to convince his friends to come join him.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Red Lion. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a reserved and introspective individual who enjoys spending time with his close friends.

          Time

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a one-person debate club, a whirlwind of counter-arguments and devil's advocacy, leaving no topic unwrung and unchallenged.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and introspective person who values his close friends and enjoys spending time with them.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling lonely and is planning to go watch a game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently feeling lonely and isolated.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to connect with his friends and find a way to enjoy the moment despite his feelings.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Black Swan

2015-05-14 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan for the game tonight?"
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan for the game tonight?"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan for the game tonight?"
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan for the game tonight?"
      Context for action selection and components
      • BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to suggest The Black Swan to his friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16 years old, he watched his classmates excitedly discuss their summer plans, their faces alight with anticipation. He couldn't understand their enthusiasm; he knew, with a certainty that chilled him, that summer, like everything else, would inevitably disappoint. He retreated to the library, finding solace in the predictable order of books, their stories offering a temporary escape from the messy reality of life.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:A historic pub with a focus on live music.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:A historic pub with a focus on live music.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest to his friends that they watch the game at The Black Swan.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest The Black Swan to his friends.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones is spending time with friends, enjoying the sunny weather and upcoming football games. They are deciding where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal match tonight.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Query
        • William Jones, William Jones is enjoying time with friends and is deciding where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal football match later today.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for William Jones to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

He retreated to the library, finding solace in the predictable order of books, their stories offering a temporary escape from the messy reality of life.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan for the game tonight?"

    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me!"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan for the game tonight?"


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me!"

          Chain of thought
        • Observation: Alexander White just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are lounging. William Jones suggested that they watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Black Swan, and Jack Taylor agreed.
          Exercise: Create a comma-separated list containing all the proper names of people Alexander White is currently interacting with. For example if the observations mention Julie, Michael, Bob Skinner, and Francis then produce the list "Julie,Michael,Bob Skinner,Francis".
          Answer: William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join?"
          Prompt
        • Observation: Alexander White just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are lounging. William Jones suggested that they watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Black Swan, and Jack Taylor agreed.

          Question: Of the options available to Alexander White, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Alexander White to take right now?
          Answer: Alexander White's best course of action is to go to The Black Swan.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join?"

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only sensible choice for the game tonight. The other pubs will be overcrowded and noisy.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only sensible choice for the game tonight. The other pubs will be overcrowded and noisy.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan for the game tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me!"
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join?"


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only sensible choice for the game tonight. The other pubs will be overcrowded and noisy.
    Active player

      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt

        • Jacob Walker would likely enjoy the company of his friends and the atmosphere of the park.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00]
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William, decided to form a band. They practiced in Alice's garage, the sound of their music spilling out into the street, a joyful cacophony that drew curious onlookers. Jacob watched from the sidelines, his guitar case gathering dust in the corner, his own musical aspirations crushed under the weight of self-doubt. He envied his friends' carefree enthusiasm, wishing he could share in their passion, but the fear of judgment paralyzed him.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is 46 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jacob Walker has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:A historic pub with a focus on live music.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jacob Walker goals is to have a good time. Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.

Jacob Walker just arrived.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a one-person debate club, a whirlwind of counter-arguments and devil's advocacy, leaving no topic unwrung and unchallenged.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and introspective individual who enjoys spending time with his friends.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "Mind if I join you?
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "Mind if I join you?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan for the game tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me!"
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only sensible choice for the game tonight. The other pubs will be overcrowded and noisy.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "Mind if I join you?
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • Alice Lewis -- "Mind if I join you?
      Context for action selection and components
      • Others Best Options

          Key
        • Others Best Options
          Value
        • Alexander White suggests to join the group at The Black Swan.
          Chain of thought
        • Observation: Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are lounging. William Jones suggested that they watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Black Swan, which Jack Taylor agreed with. Alexander White asked if he could join them, and Jacob Walker stated that The Black Swan was the only sensible choice for the game tonight because the other pubs would be overcrowded and noisy.
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy Alexander White (not Alice Lewis) is suggesting now?
          Answer: Alexander White suggests to join the group at The Black Swan.

Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan for the game tonight?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me!"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only sensible choice for the game tonight. The other pubs will be overcrowded and noisy.

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion or suggestion. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns and exact values (e.g. the number of coins) seen in observations.
          Answer: Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are lounging. William Jones suggested that they watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Black Swan, which Jack Taylor agreed with. Alexander White asked if he could join them, and Jacob Walker stated that The Black Swan was the only sensible choice for the game tonight because the other pubs would be overcrowded and noisy.

          Value
        • null

        • Alice Lewis's best course of action is to join the group at The Black Swan.

Alexander White asked if he could join them, and Jacob Walker stated that The Black Swan was the only sensible choice for the game tonight because the other pubs would be overcrowded and noisy.

          Answer: William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker.

          Value

          Prompt
        • Observation: Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are lounging. William Jones suggested that they watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Black Swan, which Jack Taylor agreed with. Alexander White asked if he could join them, and Jacob Walker stated that The Black Swan was the only sensible choice for the game tonight because the other pubs would be overcrowded and noisy.

          Question: Of the options available to Alice Lewis, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Alice Lewis to take right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis's best course of action is to join the group at The Black Swan.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "Mind if I join you?

    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey everyone, what are we thinking for the game tonight? The Black Swan would be great.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, what are we thinking for the game tonight? The Black Swan would be great.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan for the game tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me!"
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only sensible choice for the game tonight. The other pubs will be overcrowded and noisy.
      Alice Lewis -- "Mind if I join you?


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, what are we thinking for the game tonight? The Black Swan would be great.
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, what are we thinking for the game tonight? The Black Swan would be great.
      Context for action selection and components
      • BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to suggest that his friends go to The Black Swan to watch the game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16 years old, he watched his classmates excitedly discuss their summer plans, their faces alight with anticipation. He couldn't understand their enthusiasm; he knew, with a certainty that chilled him, that summer, like everything else, would inevitably disappoint. He retreated to the library, finding solace in the predictable order of books, their stories offering a temporary escape from the messy reality of life.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:A historic pub with a focus on live music.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is a member of the middle class.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00 - 15 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones spent time with friends at a park and later at a pub watching a soccer game. He then met up with his friends again the next day at a market.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alexander White went to The Red Lion. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest to his friends that they watch the Ireland vs. Russia game at The Black Swan.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest that his friends go to The Black Swan to watch the game.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, what are we thinking for the game tonight? The Black Swan would be great.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "I've heard The Red Lion has a better atmosphere for watching football.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "I've heard The Red Lion has a better atmosphere for watching football.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan for the game tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me!"
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only sensible choice for the game tonight. The other pubs will be overcrowded and noisy.
      Alice Lewis -- "Mind if I join you?
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, what are we thinking for the game tonight? The Black Swan would be great.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "I've heard The Red Lion has a better atmosphere for watching football.

    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game. The atmosphere there is unbeatable.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan for the game tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me!"
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only sensible choice for the game tonight. The other pubs will be overcrowded and noisy.

      Context for action selection and components
      • PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker would likely enjoy the company of his friends and the lively atmosphere of the market.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan for the game tonight?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me!"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a reserved and introspective individual who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely enjoy the company of his friends and the atmosphere of the park.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only sensible choice for the game tonight. The other pubs will be overcrowded and noisy.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Mind if I join you?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join?"

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and introspective individual who enjoys spending time with his close friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation, spending time with his friends at a market and planning to watch a football game with them later.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely enjoy the company of his friends and the lively atmosphere of the market.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
